shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus “Miracles of Jesus” (fols. 4ra-151vb) I-1) Introduction (fols. 4ra-11vb) - On John the Evangelist as the author of the book; on the creation and the fall of the angels (fols. 4ra-7va) - Story of the family of Adam (fols. 7va-11vb) I-2) Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus “Miracles of Jesus”: 64 miracles (fols. 11vb-151vb)
Additio 1.

donors.donor: Zä-Mäläkot (e.g., fol. 4ra), Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus (fol. 36rb), Täklä ʾEwosṭatewos (fol. 23ra) ʿAmätä Krǝstos (fol. 35rb), Zä-Giyorgis (fol. 56va), Ṣägga Krǝstos (fol. 60ra) and Wäldä Giyorgis (fol. 67ra) are mentioned in the supplication formulas.

dcomments.dcomment: Second half of the 17th cent. - second half of the 18th cent. (?) Fols. 2ra-3va are recent.

txstates.txstate: The Ms. has been rebound and resewn. Many fols. are stained with wax and dirt. A hole is carefully amended on fol. 58. The parchment guards are attached to the quires by means of side-stitches and stips of leather. The recent bifolio (fols. 2ra-3va) has been added to substitute for the lost or damaged leaves (possibly when the book was rebound).

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with brown tooled leather; textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the brown leather cover (at least 4 tools were used: double circle, triple line fillet, leaf form, x form).

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover. All quires are reinforced by recent parchment guards.

squires.squire:
{A(1+2; s.l.: 1, stub after 3;/fol. 1r-3v)} – ፩I(10/fols. 4r-13v) – ፪II(10/fols. 14r-23v) – ፫III(10; s.l.: 5, stub after 5; 6, stub after 4/fols. 24r-33v) – ፬IV(10/fols. 34r-43v) – ፭V(10/fols. 44r-53v) – ፮VI(10/fols. 54r-63v) – ፯VII(10/fols. 64r-73v) – ፰VIII(10/fols. 74r-83v) – ፱IX(12/fols. 84r-95v) – ፲X(10/fols. 96r-105v) – ፲፩XI(10/fols. 106r-115v) – ፲፪XII(10/fols. 116r-125v) – ፲፫XIII(10/fols. 126r-135v) – ፲፬XIV(8/fols. 136r-143v) – ፲፭XV(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 144r-151v) – B(1; s.l.: 1, stub before 1/fol. 152).
A recent bifolio (fols. 2r-3v) was added to quire A, probably to substitute for the lost leaves.

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

ptypeofscripts.ptypeofscript: Second half of the 17th cent. - second half of the 18th cent. (?)

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: From fol. 138rb onwards, the scribe reduced the size of the letters. Numeral ፮ “six” looks like compressed numeral ፯ “seven” (e.g., fol. 54r).

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; names of the donors; incipits of sections of Text I-1; words ምዕራፍ, ተአምር, ተአምሪሁ, ነገር followed by numbers and incipits of miracles; elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals and/or their elements. A few lines (alternating with black lines) and one group of lines on the incipit page of Text I-1.

otherdetails.otherdetail: - Only the miracles introduced with the words täʾamǝr “miracle”, täʾamrihu “his miracle” and nägär “speech” are numbered (42 miracles). The miracles introduced with the word mǝʿǝraf “chapter” are not numbered (22 miracles). - Text I-2 is followed by an ʾarke-poem, fol. 151vb.

additional.cont: Fols. 1va-3va: ˀƎsäggəd lä-mäläkotəkä... “I worship Thy Godhead…”.
additional.det: The prayer is written in a secondary hand; originally, it might have been accomodated on fols. 1r-3va (fol. 1 is only partly ruled). After the original fols. 2ra-3va were lost, a bifolio with the respective part of the text, written in a fairly recent hand, have been added to substitute for the loss.

extras.extra: - Tämälläs-sign, in the shape of a cross, indicating the place where the omission, written in the upper margin, belongs: fol. 64vb l.14. - Omitted letters, words, lines or passages written interlineally, in the main hand: fols. 38va, 40va, 51va, 56va, 90rb, 124ra, 141vb, 144rb, 148ra, 149ra, 150ra. - Corrections written over erasures: e.g., fols. 55ra, 73rb. - Erasures marked with thin lines: fols. 3rb, 109vb, 120rb, 129ra, 129vb, 133vb, 136va, 146vab. - A note has been erased from fol. 151vb. - The Ms. has been recently paginated with Arabic numbers, written in the bottom margin, in pencil. - Scribbles, doodles: fols. 5v, 148ra, 152rv.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: - Undecorated quire marks, followed by the word ጥራዝ “quire”, are written, in a secondary hand, in the left upper corner of fols. 4r, 14r, 24r, 34r, 44r. - Undecorated quire marks are written, in the main hand, in red, in the left upper corner of fols. 54r, 64r, 74r, 84r, 96r. - Undecorated quire marks are written, in a recent secondary hand, in blue pen, in the middle of the upper margin of fols. 106r, 116r, 126r, 136r, 144r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Readings of Text I-2 are indicated by the names of feasts and solemnities written in the upper margin in secondary crude hands: በበዐለ፡ እግዝእተ[sic]፡ ማርያም: fol. 8vb ደብረ፡ ዘይቱ[sic]: fol. 70rb ዘጥምቀት፡ ቍፅር፡ ፵: fol. 72vb ጥምቀት፡: fol. 75rb ዘቃና፡ ዘገሊላ፡ fol. 77rb ዘሆሣዕና: fol. 108va. - Red threads are inserted in the right upper corner of fols. 75, 92.
